page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area concerned lies 25-35 metres above sea level on raised beaches left after the Ice Age. The soil is mainly sand and gravel. The{landscape}is fairly flat. The River Carron meanders eastward towards the Firth of Forth through green fields and past areas of industrial development e.g. Lochlands Industrial Estate. There were many{ {coal}deposits in this area, but those in the immediate vicinity are no longer in use. The availability of such supplies were instrumental in the placing of the Carron{Iron}Works at Stenhousemuir in 1759.{Local history } says that "Arthur's Oon" a perfect example of Roman architecture was destroyed by Sir Michael Bruce in order to use the stone for a dam for Carron{Iron}Works.
